page.title: 09BEEKEEPING.
page.content:
By today's standards, the defined area is a good area for beekeeping. It has a high rainfall, high water table, numerous old meadows and hedgerows, with a high population of wild flowers, and many small pockets of deciduous woodland, quarries and dingles. The principal honey flows are:- May/June Oil seed rape, danadelion, and small amounts from cherry and damson. July Blackberry,clover,willow herb August Heather from nearby commonland
Field beans are an increasing farm crop in the area and will be a useful honey crop in the near future. At present there are 3 beekeepers in the area keeping a total of 28 colonies of bees.
